main.h-2: My name is Artem, I'm a frontend developer from St. Petersburg, working with React and learning UX/UI design

aeroflex.name: Technical insulation calculators
aeroflex.description1: The work was done for a client.
aeroflex.description2: The project includes the development of new calculators, as well as changing the logic of the calculators installed earlier.
aeroflex.description3: During the project it was proposed to make changes in the design, making the calculator more convenient, which the client agreed to and was satisfied with the work done.
aeroflex.description4: Legacy code support was required, which I successfully coped with, completed the project and successfully implemented it into the client's CMS system.

vzkg.name: Visual cladding material constructor
vzkg.description1: The work was carried out to the client's order.
vzkg.description2: Developed a standalone module that could be embedded into the client's CMS in the future.
vzkg.description3: There were no restrictions, but it was decided to use jQuery, as on the client's site. The logic of work is based on the use of different layers and their positioning on a fixed image.
vzkg.description4: The work was done in a style that would fit as harmoniously as possible on the client's website. The client was completely satisfied with the work.

flags.name: Directory of basic country information
flags.description1: A learning project where I applied React in conjunction with Typescript.
flags.description2: I also used React-Router for navigation, React-Redux for state storage and custom React hooks to change the theme in the application.
flags.description3: For storing and retrieving information in the application I used third-party API and Axios.
flags.description4: By the way, for styling components in this project I used Styled-Components for the sake of experimentation, although I prefer SCSS.

userFinder.name: Search and information about any GitHub user
userFinder.description1: A small training project where I used React in conjunction with Typescript.
userFinder.description2: It allows you to find any GitHub user by their nickname and get useful information about them.
userFinder.description3: I used the GitHub API to get information about GitHub users.
userFinder.description4: With this project I started my introduction to Typescript and it was an interesting experience.

library.name: A simple library
library.description1: A small training project, the point of which is to transparently use and understand React-Redux and vanilla Redux.
library.description2: It represents the basic workflow of a small library application.
library.description3: Allows adding new books and retrieving random books stored on my API server for another project or stored locally in the project.
library.description4: Books can be marked as favorites, sorted and un-favorites can be hidden. Live search on the list of books is present.

reviews.name: Review aggregator
reviews.description1: Big project, written as a final paper for an internship at iTransition.
reviews.description2: It is an app-aggregator of reviews of films, books and anything artistic. Allows you to log in via Google or GitHub, write reviews, give likes, see your likes count, comment on reviews or search for a review.
reviews.description3: The React app calls my Node.js API and fetches data from a deployed PostgreSQL database. The images are stored in a cloud service Cloudinary.
reviews.description4: The app has an option to change the theme and interface language.

calculator.name: Calculator
calculator.description2: There is a possibility to choose several design themes.
calculator.description3: The application is fully adapted for different devices.
calculator.description4: All characters work when entered from the keyboard.

todos.name: To-do list
todos.description1: There's no getting around the classic To-Do List :)
todos.description2: To use it you need to register with any email - there will be no verification.
todos.description3: The data is stored on Google Firebase service.
todos.description4: You can create to-do's and add them to the list by adding any date from your calendar, mark them as done, delete them or sort them. Overdue cases will be marked in red for your convenience.

geolocation.name: Geolocation detection by IP
geolocation.description1: A small application that I started to learn the basics of JavaScript while creating.
geolocation.description2: Using a third-party API and information provided by the browser, we can get our approximate location.
geolocation.description3: You can also get the location of any IP you are interested in.

balls.name: Landing "Balloons"
balls.description1: The time of my learning CSS and CSS preprocessors.
balls.description2: The project is written without JavaScript.
balls.description3: All attention was paid to CSS animation and adaptive, thanks to which the landing looks great on any device.

games.name: Landing "Gaming Club"
games.description2: Like Ballons project, it was written without JavaScript.
games.description3: All attention was paid to learning Flexbox and Grid - the most popular methods for creating flexible and adaptive layouts in web development.

html.name: HTML
html.description: A markup language used to create the structure of web pages. It defines content elements and their hierarchy on a page using tags.

css.name: CSS
css.description: A style language that defines the appearance and formatting of HTML elements. CSS allows you to control the colors, fonts, sizes, and positioning of elements on a web page.

js.name: JavaScript
js.description: A programming language that is used to add interactivity to web pages. It is used to create dynamic content, animations, event handling, and more.

git.name: Git
git.description: A version control system used to manage changes to a project's source code. It allows developers to track changes, create development branches, merge changes, and manage project history.

ts.name: TypeScript
ts.description: An extension of the JavaScript language that adds static typing and other features such as interfaces, enumerations, and generics. TypeScript helps improve the development process by reducing bugs and improving IDE support.

react.name: React
react.description: JavaScript library for creating user interfaces. It is used to develop interactive web applications, allowing you to create components that automatically update when data changes.

redux.name: Redux
redux.description: A state management library for JavaScript applications, often used in conjunction with React. Redux provides unidirectional data flow and a single repository for application state, making state management predictable and easy to debug.

router.name: React-Router
router.description: A routing library for React applications. React Router allows you to create single-page applications with dynamic URLs, enabling URL-based navigation between different components.

rest.name: RESTful API
rest.description: An architectural style for designing networked applications that utilizes the HTTP protocol to manipulate data. The RESTful API provides a standardized set of operations (e.g., GET, POST, PUT, DELETE) to manage resources on the server.

api.name: API
api.description: A set of definitions and protocols that is used to communicate between different components of software. An API defines how different parts of a program can communicate with each other.

npm.name: NPM
npm.description: A package manager for JavaScript used to install, manage, and publish code packages. npm allows developers to easily find and install project dependencies and share their own packages with the community.

docker.name: Docker
docker.description: A platform for developing, delivering, and running applications in containers. Docker containers provide an isolated environment for applications and their dependencies, making applications portable and easily scalable.

jquery.name: jQuery
jquery.description: A JavaScript library that facilitates HTML element manipulation, event handling, animation, and server-side interaction. jQuery makes it easy to write cross-browser JavaScript code and accelerates web application development.

node.name: Node.js
node.description: A server-side JavaScript runtime environment for building high-performance and scalable networked applications. Node.js is based on Google Chrome's V8 engine and provides asynchronous and event-driven programming.

express.name: Express
express.description: A minimalistic and flexible web framework for Node.js that makes it easy to build web applications and APIs. Express provides a set of methods and utilities for handling HTTP requests, routing, and session management.

passport.name: Passport.js
passport.description: An authentication library for Node.js that provides a simple and flexible mechanism for authentication and authorization in web applications. Supports various authentication strategies such as local authentication, OAuth, and OpenID.

mongo.name: MongoDB
mongo.description: A document-oriented NoSQL database used to store and manage data in JSON document format. MongoDB offers flexible data schema, scalability, and high performance when dealing with large amounts of data.

postgresql.name: PostgreSQL
postgresql.description: An open source relational database that supports advanced SQL features and provides reliable data storage and management. PostgreSQL offers many features including transactional support, geodata, and full-text search.

firebase.name: Firebase
firebase.description: An application development platform from Google that provides a set of tools for building high-quality web and mobile applications. Firebase includes services such as real-time database, authentication, hosting, cloud features, and more.

cloud.name: Google Cloud
cloud.description: A cloud platform provided by Google that offers various cloud services including computing resources, data storage, databases, analytics, machine learning, and more.

cloudinary.name: Cloudinary
cloudinary.description: A cloud-based service for managing media content such as images, video, and audio. Cloudinary provides APIs for uploading, processing, storing and delivering media content in web applications.

scss.name: SCSS / SASS
scss.description: A CSS preprocessor that extends the functionality of regular CSS by adding variables, nested rules, mixins, and other features to simplify and improve the styling process.

less.name: LESS
less.description: Another CSS preprocessor, similar to SCSS/SASS, that adds additional features to standard CSS, such as variables, mixins, nested styles, and more.

material.name: Material UI
material.description: A library of user interface components based on Google's Material Design system. Material UI provides ready-made components for developing modern and stylish web applications using React.

motion.name: Framer Motion
motion.description: An animation library for React that provides a simple and declarative way to create animations in web applications.  Allows you to create different types of animations such as transitions between components, animated components and more.

bootstrap.name: Bootstrap
bootstrap.description: A framework for web and mobile app development that provides a set of ready-made components and CSS styles. Bootstrap helps you create adaptive and stylish interfaces with minimal effort.

tailwind.name: Tailwind CSS
tailwind.description: A CSS framework that provides a set of ready-made classes for styling web pages. Tailwind CSS takes a utility-first approach, allowing you to quickly and flexibly create custom styles using CSS classes.

styled.name: Styled-Components
styled.description: A library for styling components in React applications using CSS as JavaScript. Styled-Components allows you to create components with bound styles, making it easy to create and maintain styled components.

vscode.name: VS Code
vscode.description: Microsoft's integrated development environment (IDE) for writing code. VS Code has many extensions, supports a variety of programming languages, and provides extensive customization options for easy and efficient development.

devtools.name: Chrome DevTools
devtools.description: Web browser developer tools, that provide developers with the ability to debug, profile, and analyze web applications. Dev Tools include tools for inspecting HTML, CSS, JavaScript, network requests, and more.

webpack.name: Webpack
webpack.description: A modular packer for JavaScript applications that allows you to combine and manage project dependencies. Webpack allows you to create static assets such as JavaScript, CSS and images and optimize them for production.

vite.name: Vite
vite.description: A fast web application development tool that utilizes modern JavaScript features such as ESM (ECMAScript Modules) and HMR (Hot Module Replacement). Vite allows you to develop web applications with speed and efficiency.

parcel.name: Parcel
parcel.description: A tool for bundling and optimizing JavaScript and CSS files. Parcel provides a simple and declarative way to build web applications using JavaScript and CSS.

babel.name: Babel
babel.description: A tool for translating JavaScript code from a modern standard to an older standard that is compatible with a wider range of browsers and JavaScript runtime environments. Allows you to take advantage of new JavaScript language features without worrying about compatibility.

postman.name: Postman
postman.description: An API testing and debugging tool that provides a user-friendly interface for sending HTTP requests and validating responses. Postman allows you to create and automate API tests and share collections of requests with other developers.

figma.name: Figma
figma.description: A graphical editor and interface design environment that allows designers to create mockups, prototypes, and collaborate on design projects in real time. Figma provides extensive capabilities for creating modern and interactive designs.

photoshop.name: Adobe Photoshop
photoshop.description: A graphic editor developed by Adobe that is widely used to create and edit images. Photoshop provides many tools for working with digital images, including retouching, applying effects, and creating compositions.

about.card1: My name is Artem Yakovenko, I'm 26 years old and I'm a frontend developer from St. Petersburg, working with React and learning UX/UI design.
about.card2: My professional journey began in the service industry, where I worked as a bartender in well-known establishments in my city, such as TOKYO-CITY and BAHROMA. The bar industry taught me about responsiveness, effective communication and time management, which has been a valuable experience in my career. Thanks to my diligence and love for my work, I quickly became a senior bartender and later opened a new restaurant VillaVerde with my colleagues.
about.card3: In 2022, I decided it was time to move on. The best decision was to change direction and immerse myself in the world of IT. I have always been attracted by the ability to instantly visualize the results of my work, which is a perfect match for frontend development and design. To master a new profession I took a lot of specialized courses and actively engaged in self-education. It is important for me to get only useful information and practice it myself, so I avoided large courses with streaming training and minimal attention to students.
about.card4: In the same year I left St. Petersburg and am now in Tashkent. Here, in 2023, I had an internship at Itransition, a large IT company, where I gained valuable experience. Then I worked on several projects with TiverGroup. At the moment, I am looking for new challenges and opportunities for growth. I am looking for a job where I can apply my experience, learn new development tools and bring maximum value to the team.
about.card5: In my free time I enjoy running, playing tennis, traveling by bike and enjoying mountain hiking. Another passion of mine is cooking. I find that having a variety of hobbies helps me find inspiration and maintain balance in my life.
